titleStmt.title: W. Ward et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG11193

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To his Excellency B Magoffin Governor of Kentucky,

The undersigned petitioners being the Jurors, who set in the case of the Commonwealth against Greenberry Henson, upon indictment for obstructing the highway, and the said Henson admitted that his fence was, or one corner of his fence was a few inches upon the road, and had been there for many years but it was put there for the benefit of said road, they state that by the instructions of the court they felt compelled to find a verdict of "Guilty of having his fence in the road 365 days" but they state that Mr Henson is a good citizen and would not intentionally violate the law, we therefore respectfully pray your Honor to remit said fine so far as is in your power to do.

Names of the Jurors
Names of Jurors
W,, Ward
Don Mitchell
Alex Browne
Nelson Wiley
E McLannahan
Henry Frank Jr
R C
B. C. Clayton
R S Suller
Enoch Pickerill
Eli Watson
J. M. Perkins

We the members of the Bar join in the above petition.
C. H. Lee.
J. B. Clarke
Jno H Bonde
G M Hamilton
John N Turber
W. E. Arthur, Atty Com'th
B. G. Willis
John Schoolfield M. Court

Bracken Cir. Ct
$365. } obstructing highway
G. S. Henson
Remission Issd
Mar. 6. 1862
